Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Monday December 16), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for monday, december 16th. 

in our first story, google's parent company, alphabet, is reportedly ramping up its investments in artificial intelligence as it announced the launch of a new ai research lab in tokyo. the lab will focus on developing next-generation machine learning techniques and has plans to collaborate with local universities to foster talent in the ai field. this move is part of alphabet’s broader strategy to expand its ai capabilities across asia.

meanwhile, microsoft has unveiled a new cloud service aimed at healthcare providers, dubbed azure health bot. this service promises to enhance patient interaction by leveraging ai-driven chatbots to provide preliminary medical advice and information. microsoft is partnering with several leading healthcare institutions to ensure that the service adheres to strict medical guidelines and privacy regulations.

lastly, amazon is making waves in the gaming industry by acquiring the indie game studio double helix games. this acquisition is seen as a step towards bolstering amazon’s push into the gaming sector, with indications that the company is set to integrate double helix’s capabilities into its cloud gaming services. this could potentially challenge industry giants like sony and microsoft in the gaming arena.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, december 16th.

starting off with alphabet, google's parent company is upping its ante in artificial intelligence. the tech giant has announced the opening of a new ai research lab in tokyo. this lab will concentrate on pioneering next-generation machine learning techniques. alphabet also plans to team up with local universities to nurture talent in the ai sector, aligning with its strategy to expand ai capabilities throughout asia.

switching gears to microsoft, the company has just launched azure health bot, a new cloud service tailored for healthcare providers. this initiative aims to improve patient interactions using ai-driven chatbots that offer initial medical advice and information. microsoft is working in partnership with top healthcare institutions to ensure the service meets stringent medical guidelines and privacy standards.

in the gaming world, amazon is making significant moves by acquiring indie game studio double helix games. this acquisition is a clear sign of amazon's growing interest in the gaming industry. the plan is to integrate double helix’s expertise into its cloud gaming services, setting the stage to compete with heavyweights like sony and microsoft.

that's it for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-173 Alphabet's Ai Expansion in Tokyo 🇯🇵, Microsoft's Healthcare Chatbots 🏥, Amazon's Gaming Acquisition 🎮
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, december 16th. dive into today's top tech stories:

  • alphabet's ai expansion in tokyo: google's parent company establishes a new ai research lab aiming to pioneer next-gen machine learning and collaborate with local universities to foster talent in asia.
  • microsoft's azure health bot: launch of a cloud service for healthcare providers featuring ai-driven chatbots to enhance patient interactions, developed in partnership with top medical institutions.
  • amazon's gaming ambitions: acquisition of indie game studio double helix games to boost amazon's cloud gaming services, positioning to rival giants like sony and microsoft.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!
Image Prompt: a dynamic podcast cover image depicting a vibrant cityscape of tokyo at dusk, with iconic landmarks softly glowing against the twilight sky. in the foreground, sleek robotic figures and abstract digital symbols, representing alphabet's ai expansion, blend into the busy urban environment, symbolizing the seamless integration of technology and city life. rising above the city, a futuristic skyscraper with digital billboards showcases animated avatars interacting within a virtual healthcare setting, illustrating microsoft's innovative healthcare chatbots. to the left, an expansive gaming universe emerges, where diverse virtual landscapes and characters converge, symbolizing amazon's significant gaming acquisition. the elements come together harmoniously, reflecting a hub of technological advancement and interconnected innovation
